adjective.description: Denoting the soft or dim light characteristic of twilight or dusk.
examples: the dimpsy light of early evening
they were driving home across Bodmin Moor and the light was dimpsy
I hate cycling in this dimpsy half light
at dimpsy, she heard the blackbirds scolding the wood owls

origin: Late 17th century (as noun): originally as dimps, perhaps from dim.
